alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 02 at 11:38AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, South Central Mountains. In north central New Mexico, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered to numerous thunderstorms are expected to develop over the Central Mountain Chain today. With plenty of moisture in place and slow storm motions expected, locally heavy rainfall is expected. Rain rates may reach 1 inch per hour in the strongest cells. The risk of flash flooding will be focused over the Hermit`s Peak Calf Canyon and McBride burn scars. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
